phrase.cizu_name: the (whole) kit and caboodle【非正式用语】

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Middle Dutch kitte 'wooden vessel', of unknown origin. The original sense 'wooden tub' was later applied to other containers; the use denoting a soldier's equipment (late 18th cent.) probably arose from the idea of a set of articles packed in a container
early 16th cent.: perhaps from Latin cithara (see cittern)

entry.def: A kit is a group of items that are kept together, often in the same container, because they are all used for similar purposes.

example.ex: The kit consisted of about twenty cosmetic items and a lady's shaver.
example.tran: 整套工具包括大约20种化妆用品和一个女士褪毛器。

entry.tran: （尤指某运动的）全套衣服和装备
entry.def: Kit is special clothing and equipment that you use when you take part in a particular activity, especially a sport.
A kit is a set of parts that can be put together in order to make something.

example.ex: Her popular pot holder is also available in do-it-yourself kits.
example.tran: 她那广受欢迎的防烫布垫也可以自己购买原料套装自己制作。

entry.tran: 脱掉所有衣服/不脱掉所有衣服
entry.def: If someone gets their kit off or takes their kit off, they take off all their clothes. If they keep their kit on, they do not take off all their clothes, even though people may be expecting them to.

example.ex: I don't like taking my kit off on screen...
example.tran: 我不喜欢在银幕上表演裸戏。

example.ex: Back in the Fifties, social convention required that males models keep their kit on.
example.tran: 回首50年代，那时社会习俗要求男模不能脱掉所有衣服。

means.word_mean: 1. a case for containing a set of articles
2. gear consisting of a set of articles or tools for a specified purpose
3. young of any of various fur-bearing animals;
1. supply with a set of articles or tools
